content.prompt:
© Erich Lessing / Art Resource, NY

The artist of the Madonna and Child shown achieved an effect of elegance and grace primarily through the

choices.label: arrangement of the cluster of angels on the left side of the painting
elongated bodily proportions and the gesture of the Madonna’s head and neck
alternation of light and dark colors across the middle and bottom of the painting
lines created by gazes, from the front angel, to the Madonna, to the infant Christ

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 5.B: In analyzing a work of art beyond the image set, explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
